Instrument.name: The Spatial Infrared Imaging Telescope (SPIRIT III) for the Midcourse Space Experiment
Instrument.description: The Spatial Infrared Imaging Telescope (SPIRIT III) was a 33cm clear-aperture off-axis telecope that contained two focal-plane instruments: a multispectral high spatial resolution (18') radiometer and a six-channel high spectral resolution (R~20cm^-1), 2.5 to 28 micron Fourier transform spectrometer. The radiometer had four broad spectral bands (A, C, D, and E) and two narrow bands (B1 and B2), covering the range 6.8-25.1 microns and 4.22-4.45 microns, respectively. Detector pixels were square with a pixel scale of 18.3 arcsec/pixel.
